This is the loader application that's used by millions of people worldwide, well known for passing Microsoft's WAT (Windows Activation Technologies) and is arguably the safest Windows activation exploit ever created. The application itself injects a SLIC (System Licensed Internal Code) into your system before Windows boots; this is what fools Windows into thinking it's genuine.
@lanjimsdk: no you can't turn automatic updates on.!

Those asking if its safe to run windows update with this, the is answer is "it depends"...

Recent versions of the Daz loader install a unique crack on every system making it impossible for Microsoft to detect or disable it like older versions. 

If you get a "not genuine" error after using this, it because of an older previously installed crack that messed with the WAT. 

A clean untouched windows 7 install + this loader is 100% safe (till now, atleast) with all windows updates including kb971033 :)
